Description of incident: A computer server within InterActive              Financial Marketing Group (IFMG), a division of Dominion Enterprises              located in Richmond, Virginia, was hacked into and illegally accessed              by an unknown and unauthorized third party between November 2007 and              February 2008. The data intrusion resulted in the potential exposure              of personal information, including the names, addresses, birth dates,              and Social Security numbers of 92,095 applicants who submitted credit              applications to IFMG's family of special finance Web sites.
